meanings.definition: A substance believed to emanate from the body of a medium during a spiritualistic trance.
meanings.sent1: During the seance, the medium's ectoplasm seemed to glow in the dim light.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure was said to be formed from ectoplasm.
meanings.sent3: The ectoplasmic mist enveloped the room, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity flowed like ectoplasm, shaping new ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The ectoplasmic residue left behind a trail of mystery and wonder.

meanings.definition: The outer portion of the cytoplasm of a cell.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the ectoplasm of the cell appeared transparent and thin.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the movement of ectoplasm within the cell.
meanings.sent3: The ectoplasm of the cell seemed to dance under the lens of the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The ectoplasmic boundary of the cell determined its shape and structure.
meanings.sent5: The ectoplasm provided support and structure to the cell membrane.
